name.value: All For The Regiment: The American Civil War in Miniature

item.description:
All For The Regiment is a regimental scale miniatures simulation of the American Civil War. The conflict saw two armies that were very similar in terms of training, doctrine, and to a lesser degree society. This led to many stalemated battles. It also meant the differences in leadership, numbers, weapons, and overall unit quality was crucial in deciding the outcomes of many battles.

—description from the designer

Compete to Cooperate, then Cooperate to Compete with Codetalk

WHAT IS CODETALK?

Codetalk is a unique strategic board game for 2 to 4 players. It combines the elements of Korean traditional game O-MOK and Color Match. Each player takes turns putting down their color chip on an empty grid. The player wins when the row of 3 chips are created. (Horizontally, Vertically, or Diagonally)

PREPARE GAME

Put the Grid-Board at the center of the table and choose your chip color. (Yellow, Red, Blue, Green). Make sure each color has 20 chips. Make a short game for your own to choose the first player. The game goes with a clockwise.

HOW TO PLAY


 First player puts the chip on the grid. Make sure you tell other players of your number. (It’s called ‘rule setting’)
 The number is now became a new rule where the next player has to put the chip on the particular Grid-Board No. told by the first player. Then, the player puts the chip on any number of the grid for a new rule setting. 
 Repeat Step 1 and 2 till the game ends.


END THE GAME

The game chooses the winner when a player firstly create 3 chips in a row. It can be horizontal, vertical or diagonal. It is up to you!

We draw the game if all chips are gone while no one created the row. Then, we restart the game!

—description from the designer

Players compete to craft the funniest, raunchiest and most ridiculous porn parody titles for Hollywood movies. A judge player draws a card with the title of a movie on it then all players take turns creating the most porn parody like title of the movie. The judge awards points for the most creative! Play continues around the table until a set amount of points are reached. Cards include a parody title at the bottom for bonus points if someone guesses it.

A card with many lines written. You will make your face according to what you drew from it. It can be a self-taken photograph, or it can be made by combining various pieces. Pieces are limited, but depending on your creativity, you can make a look that surprises everyone.
Win it if everyone can hit the subject line! Can you describe your feelings well "face"?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Lifeguard is a cooperative game for 2-4 players; these players are a team of lifeguards at a crowded and chaotic outdoor pool, trying to prevent hazards and save any victims before it's too late.

The players create the shape and depth of their own pool; each zone in the pool fills and empties throughout the game with different risks, hazards, and victims in the form of facedown cards. The guards work furiously to flip over these cards and then work together to deal with whatever emergencies they uncover. Any waste of time results in more facedown cards in their pool, which means any unseen victims' conditions are growing more and more serious, making them harder to save.

In addition to the pool itself, the players can customize the difficulty of the game by adding more hazards or victims into the deck, as well as choose special characters and special abilities for themselves.

—description from the designer

The players have to travel through Italy from space 1 to space 80. The movement of the pawns is determined by a die. In some cities, events hinder or benefit the players. The last player who arrives on space 80 wins the game.

—user summary

PASS THE BUCK!
An elimination game
Don't get stuck with the drag in the office! Everybody is passing the mess and nobody wants to be the loser. Pass the buck, go and get a coffee to sneak away and try not to fall asleep while your colleagues pester you or you will get stuck with a new one!
Easy, fast-paced and extra funny card game. It can be played individually or in teams.

Each player has 3 cards.
There are 4 types of cards:

 Bucks: you pass the mess putting this card in front of a player.
 Pass the buck: moves the bucks card from one player to another.
 Fall asleep: forces a player to lose a turn.
 Coffee: protects from receiving bucks cards.




By turns, each player will use a card and take a new card from the deck.

When a player gets 3 bucks cards in front of him, he will be eliminated from the game.

The surviving player will be the winner.

—description from the designer

Woop wooop! A gang of burglars is in town. Luckily, the police are on call!

In Wooop Wooop, the game box turns into a police car with a police figure driving it. The players then try to find as many matching burglars as possible.

ROKURIGO is a two-player abstract strategy game that contains elements of Reversi.

The playing area is a 6x6 grid, although players will be placing their pieces only in the central twenty spaces. Each player has three types of double-sided pieces that mirror the numbers you find on opposite sides of a standard six-sided die: 1/6, 2/5, and 3/4, with five of each piece. Some numbers are printed on the game board.

Players take turns placing a piece on the game board. You can freely place one of your pieces in the four central spaces or on the second-closest row of the game board. If you want to place a piece elsewhere, though, you must "sandwich" a piece Reversi-style in order to flip it. You need to track the sum of numbers visible because if you bring the total to 33, then you capture one of the opponent's pieces. If you bring the total to 37 or more, then you lose the game instantly, so think carefully before you flip something!

name.value: ラララうちゅう (Ra ra ra uchû)

link.value: イマジンゲームズ (imagine GAMES)
イマジンゲームズ (imagine GAMES)

item.description:
In Visioo, every player has to prove his or her perception skills. The stack of cards is divided in equal parts for each player. Then every player flips a card at the same time. The cards are put side by side in the middle of the table. Now every player tries to find two objects that are the same, but differ in color – as soon as this happens, the player that has found a couple wins the cards.

There is however not always a couple to find. If after a couple of moments the players agree to not find anything, everyone flips another card and puts it next to the other ones. Now there are more cards to look at, but thus also more cards to win or lose! Pressure is up!

In the end, the player with the most cards wins the game.

—user summary

It is said that Wiraqocha created the sun and the pre-Columbian tribes of the Andes.

Under his leadership, those who will train the mighty Inca people came out of their caves to discover new horizons in order to subsist and grow in harmony with nature. They venerated Pachamama, Mother Earth, the basis of all living things, plants and minerals, on earth and under the earth. Lead your tribe into unknown territory in search of new lands to cultivate. Your goal: To explore regions and draw outlines to develop cultures according to the customs and legacies of Pachamama. If you honor Her by respecting its great principles of diversity and complementarity, Nature will reward you. Otherwise, you will suffer his wrath.
In this race, risk taking, deduction, intuition and a good sense of timing should allow you to get through.

It’s up to you to choose the type of scenario depending on the number of players and the type of game you want: Quick and opportunistic or longer, more developed and strategic.


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


RUNNING OF THE GAME ROUNDS

++++++ ++++++++++++++++++++

Starting with the first player and turning clockwise, each player must perform one and only one of the following 3 actions:


 EXPLORE
 MOVE
 MAKE DIVINATION


During his turn, the player can also if he wishes (and if he has the necessary offerings)


 MAKE AN OFFERING TO PACHAMAMA


The end of the game is triggered when all lands have been discovered.


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


1. EXPLORE

++++++ +++++

REGIONS AND LAND TILES

Exploring allows you to discover and reveal the unknown territory of the playing area by placing Land Tiles and determine the outlines of the Regions.

RULES OF MOVE


 The player moves any of his explorers (one per turn) to an empty virtual square in the playing area (a square without a Land Tile).
 Explorers still not engaged on the playground can enter any peripheral square.
 An explorer moves only orthogonally.
 An explorer moves one square OR can “jump” explorers of his color AND any cultivated Land Tile. In other words, the explorers of his own color and all the cultivated Tiles form a “path” on which explorers can move without limitation of distance.
 On the other hand, an exporer can never pass over an opponent explorer. There can never be more than one explorer per Tile.
 For an action, an explorer, wherever he is, can “get out” of the playing area. This can be very useful for example if an explorer was to be “blocked” and no move is possible anymore.


DISCOVER A LAND

When the explorer stops on an empty square, he “discovers” it automatically:

The active player announces the coordinates of the square on which his explorer is located: a letter and a number.
The player with the Pachamama Wheel in hand turns the Disc (“shutter closed”) to the coordinates of the square announced by the active player.
Then he opens the “shutter” to reveal the type of Land Tile to lay (Swamp, Desert, Mountain or Forest)
The active player takes this Land Tile in the reserve and puts it on the virtual square, under its Explorer
Finally, the player takes an offering cube corresponding to the Land Tile he has just discovered. At any time, a player may trade 2 Offering Cubes for another.
Attention: a player can never have more than 4 Offering Cubes in his possession. If he receives a 5th, he does not take it where in exchange 2 against 1.

2. JUST MOVE

++++++ +++++++

In turn a player may decide to simply move one of his explorers without discovering new terrain.

3. MAKE DIVINATION
WHAT IS DIVINATION?

Make divination is to propose to Pachamama the field that can be planted where your explorers are. There can only be one solution each time.

By announcing the right kind of culture, Pachamama honors you: you earn points. If you make a mistake, Pachamama punishes you: you lose points.

WHAT ARE THE 3 RULES OF PACHAMAMA?

In a Region of 1 tile, there is necessarily a Culture 1. In a Region of 2 tiles, there is necessarily a Culture 1 AND a Culture 2. And so on.
In a Region, there can only be ONE Field of the same type
Two Fields of the same type can never be adjacent, neither orthogonally nor diagonally.

HOW TO PROCESS TO A DIVINATION?

In turn, for each of its explorers on a Land Tile non cultivated, the player can try to guess and announce which Field should be there (after deduction, at random or... thanks to a sweet mixture of 2 !)
We then turn the Pachamama Disc to the coordinates of the Tile in question and remove the Viracocha Pawn ( ) to reveal the answer.

If it’s the right answer:
The player puts the corresponding Field Token on the Tile
The player scores as many points as the size of the Field (from 1 to 5) and he moves forward his Score Stone.
In case of right answer, the player moves forward his Diversity Stone on the scale corresponding to the Field he has just put. He scores additional points as explained below in the chapter “Diversity Scale”
If he wants to, he can continue making divinations on anothers Tiles with anothers of his explorers.

If it’s a bad answer:
The player puts the corresponding Field Token on the Tile
The player loses as many points as the size of the Field of the correct answer.
He can not continue to attempt divination with his other explorers: his turn ends there. Note: we can go below 0.

4. MAKE AN OFFERING TO PACHAMAMA
As soon as he has recovered 4 different types of offering (), a player can discard them to make an offering to Pachamama.
An offering may allow the player to: do an additional action immediately or consult the Pachamama Disc to see what kind of feil there is on any empty space not yet discovered or any discovered tile.

END OF THE GAME
The end of the game is triggered when a player places the last Land Tile on the Playground (ie there are no more empty spaces on the Playground).
All players, starting with the player who has just laid the last Land Tile can then do one after another 1 divination, one explorer after another.
Each player can also discard his offering Cubes to score one point per cube.
The player with the most points is declared the winner.

—description from the publisher

The game is divided into several rounds during which the active player draws a card and randomly chooses 1 of 5 symbols.

They draw that symbol on the palm of person sitting to their left, while that person closes their eyes.

Go around the circle receiving and tracing on palms (like Telephone).

At the end, the card is revealed and all players vote on what they believe was the starting symbol.

At the end of the turn, you receive as many victory points as the number of players in a row who successfully guessed the symbol.

Once everybody has been the active player once, the player scoring the most VPs wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
You start with a single black sandtimer. Flip it and when it runs out, take a black cube. Flip it again to start the production of a new black cube. Indeed, each sandtimer is a factory.

With the cubes, purchase cards in the middle of the table which will give you more cubes of various colours, new sandtimers or victory points.

Flip Factory is played simultaneously by 2 – 4 players.

You need to get 7 victory points to win.

—description from the publisher

Conquer three citadels to win the game. Use strings to conquer adjacent spaces: Make a knot with one of your strings and place it on an adjacent space to add it to your kingdom.

If you want to conquer an adjacent space owned by an opponent: Take her knot out of this space, undo the knot, give the string back to its owner, take one of your strings, make a knot, place it on this space.

Play simultaneous. Be fast!

—description from the publisher

name.value: アリスアセンブル (Alice Assemble)

item.description:
A Game of Staging Ridiculous Interventions about Nonsensical Problems.

Caring friends and family have all gathered “because they LOVE you”. That’s how it always starts. That’s when you suddenly realize there’s a problem - and it’s YOU. You’re shocked and clueless, which is why your loved ones have taken it upon themselves to carefully broach the subject. Naturally, no one wants to just come right out and say it. So they keep hinting at it, hoping you’ll catch on eventually. But will you? Or will this Intervention fail?

In this game, players take turns being the focus of an intervention by drawing a Problem card with a nonsensical problem like, "Uncontrollable Interpretive Dancing" or "Neurotic Inability to Turn Right". They can't see the card, but all the Concerned Friends and Family can. Friends will give obscure clues that hint at the problem, without giving it away. The sooner the Intervened can guess the problem, the more points they'll score. The longer the Concerned Friends keep them guessing, the more points the Friends can earn. Each of the three rounds have a unique format for giving clues, Broaching the Subject, The Emotional Appeal and Offering a Solution. But if the Intervened cannot guess their problem by the end of the third round, no one will score any points, having failed to help their friend.

—description from the publisher

Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multi-ball.

Tempus Imperium is a 30 minute solo game that plays like a roll and write, but instead of rolling dice you use the date and time to setup the board and determine your actions.

Build roads to connect to resources, grow your empire, defeat enemies and earn gold to get the most points in 5 rounds.

The setup is based on the date and time, so every minute is a unique game.

link.value: Tempus Quest Episode 0: Some Re-Assembly Required

item.description:
Don’t let the dim light of the full moon mislead you. Tonight Dark City is shadow territory. Monsters prowl the streets, craving for blood, and they’ll do anything to keep their hunting grounds. Humankind has its guardians, however few and far between, and they fight for their lives with matching ferocity. Who will survive another showdown on the gloomy streets of Dark City?

Dark City is a party game in which players choose iconic characters from the cast of a horror movie – vampires, werewolves, zombies, hunters, priests – then face their opponents in a fierce battle of wits, inference and finger-pointing.

Every round, the Acting Player randomly discards three cards from the deck. Then, one by one, players draft a monster or guardian at their choice from among the remaining cards. Players attack their chosen target by aiming their monster’s or guardian’s signature gesture at it. Then players have a chance to flee the battle, trying to prevent their opponents from scoring. Attacks are resolved in initiative order. Successful attacks “kill” their targets and allow players to achieve their monster’s or guardian’s goals. Players whose monsters or guardians have “survived” the encounter and achieved their goals score experience points (XP).The game ends when one or more players gather enough XP to meet at least one of the four victory conditions.

—description from the publisher

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
The briefcase is out in the open, and six freelance agents are in the field.

In Conspiracy: The Solomon Gambit, a restoration of the 1973 classic game conspiracy, players vie for control of the agents by secretly paying them off and using them to move the briefcase across Europe, trying to get it to their HQ. But other players can challenge and stop an agent from moving if they have paid more than you — and for the right price they can even assassinate another agent.

In addition to a slick new look, this restored edition offers two new twists on the original gameplay. First, each agent has a unique ability that lets them move an agent or the briefcase for free. Second, an alternate win condition eliminates stalling and potential stalemates. If no one wins within a certain number of turns, Dr. Solomon can end the game immediately, and whoever has paid off the most to him wins the game. However, if you pay off too much to Dr. Solomon early in the game, that can leave you with little control over the other agents, forcing you to strike a tricky balance between immediate and long-term goals.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Contract will be received for 5 days (rounds) from Monday to Friday. It is a game in which players earn money to construct a port facility, process contracts of contracts, and win he highest victory points.


 This game is available for 2 to 4 players.
 Players play for 5 rounds from Monday to Friday.
 Each round consumes an optimal amount of time, depending on you situation, for an average of eight hours. Apart from that, 4 hours each round can be used at an additional cost. This is 8 hours a day you have to work overtime and pay for it.
 You can become a winner of the game by optimizing your time and taking advantage of it.

Card game combining memory and risk taking with a cooperative version.

The cards "the wolf arrives" are placed face up, each player receives a house card and we place all other cards face down on the table. Each player in turn returns as many cards as he wishes in order to reveal and recover the animals from his house. But he must stop and win nothing if he returns a card he has already revealed or if he returns a wolf card. In the latter case he returns a card "the wolf arrives", unless he returned a card clover. When a player has collected the 4 animals from his house, he puts the cards aside and draws a new house. The game is over when all the cards "the wolf arrives" are returned or when all the animals are safe. This is the player with the most cards "animal" who wins. In the cooperative version the players play together against the wolf!

—user summary

Quantum Wordcraft is a crossword style game for all ages. Each player draws 7 cards and then rolls two dice for bonus categories or an extra card. Cards are worth 1-4 points depending on rarity.

It has similarities to Scrabble, but without the need for a bulky game board. No need for a board makes it very portable. You can also play words over other words.

—description from the publisher

Westbrooke: Out Last is a zombies vs. humans game that pits you against time and each other. Work with your team of fellow survivors to escape the zombie ridden city of Westbrooke before it gets destroyed by a nuclear bomb.

As humans you must move from tile to tile locating objectives, fighting off zombies, and collecting items and weapons. Use the custom dice to fight off zombies. Once you and your teammates have collected the objectives make you must make your way to the exit before the nuke gets dropped.

The opposing zombie team places zombies of all sorts in the path of the humans to try and stop them from reaching the exit. If they are going down they are taking the humans with them.

The Deluxe Edition contains two additional characters — the Priest and the Scout — as well as 18 extra Phase cards (items, weapons, and strategy cards).

Don't look at TV shows anymore, create them!

You are TV show writers and together, you'll create the new successful TV series.
To be crowned best scriptwriter, you'll have to know every details by heart.
Tell your TV plot by playing location, character and event cards and remember a maximum of details to win the game!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: Paw Patrol: Don't Drop Chase Action Game

item.description:
Players take turns knocking out the ice blocks, but be careful. The one that drops Chase loses the game.

How to play:

 Randomly insert ice blocks into tray.
 Carefully turn the tray over and place the Chase standee on the center ice block.
 Spin the wheel and take your turn knocking out the ice blocks, but be careful. The player that drops Chase loses the game.




—description from the publisher

item.description:
Simple Roll and Move game featuring characters from the movie Cars 3. Players use a spinner to move along a racetrack with obstacles like flat tires, oil slicks or suddenly running out of fuel.

—user summary

Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset. 
Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Me-163, the only rocket-powered aircraft to see combat. Scenarios include:
Bat Out Of Hell: Komets bounce a flight of P-38 Lightnings
Point Defense: Me-163 Komets assisted Fw-190D fighters attacking a formation of B-17G bombers and their P-51D escorts.
Red Komet: Returning from a mission with no fuel, a lone Me-163 has to glide past marauding P-51D fighters to return to base.

link.value: Table Air Combat: B-17F Flying Fortress

item.description:
Play cards, roll dice and don't get fired!

In Cooking Customers you will need to hire cooks to make meals so that you can serve you customers and win the game all while avoiding horrible kitchen injuries, health inspections and complaining customers

In this restaurant based game each player is dealt five cards and a table card. The table card has two sides, one side indicating how many meals you must cook and the other side indicating the tip you earn for completing the table.

Each turn you can play up to two cards. One on yourself and one on your opponents, or you can just discard one or both. You want cook cards, which are needed to roll the dice and cook meals. Other cards include kitchen injuries, health inspectors and the like to slow your opponents down as well as energy drinks, thief's and trainees to help you get your meals cooked.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to earn $20 in tips.

-description from designer

name.value: Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (7th Edition)

item.description:
This is the seventh edition of very popular Warhammer Fantasy Battles wargame, a refinement of the sixth edition rules, without radical changes.

Warhammer Fantasy Battles is a tabletop game for two or more players where you command several armies from a huge range that goes from Imperial Humans, Dwarves, High Elves, Undead Vampires, Orcs, Beastman, Ratmen called skaven and lots of races. This book provides you with all the rules you need to play, and guides you through collecting and painting your own army of Citadel miniatures.

The Warhammer rulebook is a 288-page hardback book. Within its covers the book is divided into four sections. The Basic Rules tell you how to field your army on the tabletop; the Advanced Rules cover rare and potent troops such as war machines, chariots, monsters, mighty heroes and powerful wizards; the Warhammer World is your guide to the history, races and armies of Warhammer, including full-colour photographs of the forces you can collect; and the Hobby Section gives you advice on how to choose, collect, assemble and paint your army, as well as extra information about terrain and multiple scenarios.

link.value: Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (8th Edition)
Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (6th Edition)

item.description:
A fast-paced, action, skirmish wargame in 32mm scale, set in a dystopian science-fantasy universe. Starcide reaches between the realms of sci-fi and fantasy with a dazzling variety of factions to select from including:

Legion of the Black Sun (blood-thirsted vampires and Soul-rending necromancers), Empire of Man (Unified Noble Houses of mankind) , Na'vo (cold-blooded reptiles), Prometheans (a human-like Psionic race), and the Locust (deadly insectoids with biotechnological space travel).

—description from the publisher

name.value: Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age

item.description:
Oathmark is battle-scale miniatures wargame, featuring 32mm figures drawn up in ranks and files. Each figure is its own playing piece with its own profile: unlike in some systems, they're not just for show, with the unit base as the only mechanically relevant piece. Attacks and other actions are adjudicated by D10 rolls.

There is a dedicated miniatures range by North Star. Races include Dwarves, Elves, Goblins, and Humans.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (6th Edition)
Warhammer: El juego de batallas fantasticas
Warhammer: Il gioco delle battaglie fantasy

item.description:
This is the sixth edition of very popular Warhammer Fantasy Battles wargame, a radical change from fifth edition, with major changes to army composition, magic and balance of power between heroes and units.

Warhammer Fantasy Battles is a tabletop game for two or more players where you command several armies from a huge range that goes from Imperial Humans, Dwarves, High Elves, Undead Vampires, Orcs, Beastman, Ratmen called skaven and lots of races. This book provides you with all the rules you need to play, and guides you through collecting and painting your own army of Citadel miniatures.

The Warhammer rulebook is a 288-page hardback book. Within its covers the book is divided into six sections. The Rules tell you how to field your army on the tabletop; the Advanced Rules cover rare and potent troops such as war machines, chariots, monsters, mighty heroes and buildings; Magic explains how to use magic items and cast spells; World of Warhammer is your guide to the history, races and armies of Warhammer, including full-colour photographs of the forces you can collect; the Scenarios section gives you advice on how to create your own scenarios with some examples, as well as information about terrain; and Appendix contains information how to run campaigns, and a lot of other useful hints.

link.value: Warhammer: Conquest of the New World
Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (6th Edition Boxed Set)
Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (7th Edition)
Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (5th Edition)

item.description:
A fun party game about everything you thought that you and your friends thinks in the same way.

One of the players reads the question from the card. Team members have 30 seconds to try to guess what the partners will answer and write the same answer separately.

The group that received the most correct answers can move the button forward on the board.

The winner is the team that reaches 30 points before the others.

Hemispheres pits 2 halves of the same brain against each other. Each half is trying to control the entire brain. To do this, each player has the same 8 cards as their opponent. Each player is trying to out think their opponent to swing the personality meter all the way to their side of the brain and take total control.

Turns are played simultaneously by choosing the card to play each round and then revealing them together (along with each cards special Trait chosen that turn). After applying the Traits, the final Power values are compared to affect the Node track (score). Cards have a cool off period before returning to the hand. Choosing the right Power value and right Trait becomes a mind game against your opponent. This game is best played against the same opponent repeatedly to get into each others's brains.

This game was originally designed for the 2016 2-Player PnP Contest.

—description from the designer

Medieval fantasy game for 2-5 players where the board changes every time you play. Play cards from your hand against defending dice rolls in order to take control of land and net victory points for your faction. Brave wild encounters to attain powerful enhancements or gain helpful advantages without risk. Through the 10 rounds collect the most victory points in order to become the leading force on the board at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
The Golden Girls Trivial Pursuit bite-size edition contains 600 questions based on all seven seasons of the Emmy Award-winning TV series.

Create magical mischief with Unicorn Surprise! In this whimsical game, players are transformed into pixies on the hunt for colorful unicorn gems. The only problem – unicorns drop their Gems but once a year! Race against other cheeky pixie players to collect the most gems before the smiling sun sets. Unicorn Surprise combines board game suspense with a silly unicorn figure that pixie players can interact with. Will she drop a colored gem or a clear one signifying the end of the day? Find out when you play Unicorn Surprise!

—description from the publisher

A quick two player pattern matching game using a double-sided connect-four-esque board. Each turn, players roll a die to determine what color token they can add to the board, and then try to match one of the shown 3-token patterns. The board and pattern cards are circular, and each of the tokens are double sided with two colors, creating pleasing aesthetics.

Catch Me! is a simple card game for 2 to 6 players. Each player receives a stack of face down cards displaying patterns in different colours. In the middle of the table there's a wooden stick up for grabs. Every round, a player turns over one of their face down cards. If two players have cards of the same pattern in front of them, both players compete to "catch" the stick first. The loser of this duel receives the winner's active cards to add to their stack. Whoever gets rid of all their cards first wins the game!

Duel cards are included as a variant.

—user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups

name.value: Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (5th Edition)
Warhammer: El juego de batallas fantasticas

item.description:
This is the fifth edition of very popular Warhammer Fantasy Battles wargame, a colorful refinement of the fourth edition rules, in which heroes and magic still dominate over units and war machines.

Warhammer Fantasy Battles is a tabletop game for two or more players where you command several armies from a huge range that goes from Humans, Dwarves, Elves, Undead, Orcs, Beastmen, Ratmen called Skaven, and other fantasy races. This starter set provides you with all the rules you need to play, a core for two armies, and guides you through collecting and painting your own army of Citadel miniatures.

The boxed set contains a 112-page softback Rulebook, a 152-page softback Battle Book, plastic miniatures from the newly introduced Bretonnian (12 Knights of the Realm, 24 Peasant Bowmen) and Lizardmen (20 Saurus Warriors, 32 Skinks) armies. It also contains plastic dice and range rulers, as well as cardboard playsheets, buildings, templates, and magic cards - everything required to start playing.

link.value: Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (6th Edition)
Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (4th Edition)

item.description:
Have you ever planted a forest? If not, it's time!

Here you can hear birds singing, Help me through the trees!

In this game, we invite you to plant the forest! Your profit will be to grow five trees. Each of them consists of four parts. You roll two dice, and in the factory you choose more elements. The person who is the first to grow five trees wins.

The box comes with a seed! They are tiny, but do not be fooled by appearances. Giant trees will grow out of them!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name.value: Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (4th Edition)

item.description:
This is the fourth edition of very popular Warhammer Fantasy Battles wargame, a radical change from third edition, with major changes to army composition, magic and unit attributes.

Warhammer Fantasy Battles is a tabletop game for two or more players where you command several armies from a huge range that goes from Humans, Dwarves, Elves, Undead, Orcs, Beastmen, Ratmen called Skaven, and other fantasy races. This starter set provides you with all the rules you need to play, a core for two armies, and guides you through collecting and painting your own army of Citadel miniatures.

The boxed set contains a 96-page softback Rulebook, a 96-page softback Battle Bestiary, a 24-page Warhammer Armies booklet, plastic miniatures from the High Elves (20 Spearmen, 20 Archers) and Goblins (32 Spearmen, 32 Archers) armies. It also contains plastic dice, as well as cardboard playsheets, units, buildings, templates, and magic cards - everything required to start playing.

link.value: White Dwarf Presents: Warhammer Chaos Dwarfs
Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (5th Edition)

item.description:
Gartenbau is a 2-4 player game in which players place and layer tiles in a tableau in an effort to meet the growing requirements of specifically drafted flower tiles.

You and your fellow players are gardeners racing to create and grow a garden that contains four fully mature flowers, along with other seedlings and plants, in an effort to earn the most prestige by fulfilling each of the flower’s unique growing requirements.
The player with the most prestige at the end of the game is crowned Gartenmeister - The Master Gardener.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
A solitaire sports replay game which enables the player to replay Cycling Grand Tours stage by stage.
Chart and dice system, which requires a race data book for each tour. Each data book contains the ratings of each cyclist in the particular tour.
The race unfolds stage by stage. It allows for time gaps, mountain points and finish line sprint points to be totalled.
Flat stages hilly stages, mountain stages and time trials are all included.

é…’é­…äºº is a game about making SAKE (Japanese Rice Wine.) 
The player becomes the owner of SAKE brewery and decides which process to focus on SAKE made by himself.
All the attention boards dealt to players are the same. Every round player should bidding for the sequence to get the materiel. For that reason, it is important what kind of criteria you will score on sake made by yourself.

Because the evaluation point of sake is not equal to the victory point, you can scoop up your feet if you are too busy drinking!
No knowledge of sake is necessary, bow hits competing with each other!

link.value: Super Number One Games (スーパー ナンバーワン ゲームズ)

item.description:
In addition to the Season 2 Battle Chest, the Champion Edition includes:
- Printed Season 2 Comic Book
- Box spot varnish and printed box liner

- Hero randomizer deck for all of Season One and Season Two
- Season One "So Wild!" promo pack with alternate art

link.value: Dice Throne: Season Two – Battle Chest
Dice Throne: Season Two – Cursed Pirate v. Artificer

item.description: This release is part of a 3-item set released in 2.5 inch round metal tins by University games. This game includes 30 second mysteries of "Solve the Mystery", "Solve the Mystery Gram", and "Solve the Brainteaser". Each includes 64 cards.

Is tonight a night where you want insane family fun, or do you feel ruthless, and want to show your competitive side?

Zombies The Cure is a board game where you and your family will have just pure crazy family fun.

Zombies The Cure board game turns into a crazy fun card game. Take the game deck of cards combined with all the expansion packs then becomes a very competitive stand-alone card game for you and your friends to play.

So... go ahead and have some pure crazy family fun tonight.

A Government experiment has gone badly wrong, turning human and creature into the not-so-dead Zombies, monsters, freaks, and some ugly but cute little critters! Zombies are leading to the collapse of civilization, the not-so-dead, or not-so-living is taking over the living, unless it is dealt with quickly all hope will be lost. A cure exists, all you must do is pick it up and carry it to the lab, but be careful trust no one, not even your friends they will kill you, to be the one who takes the cure to the lab.

Zombies The Cure board game requires a mixture of luck and strategy, making it a fun, unpredictable game for the whole family. This kid-friendly, super-competitive, killer-fun game is Just Pure Crazy Family Fun.

The material can also be used to play 9RUN the card game, which can be played one single round or can be played with multiple rounds to see who has the highest stockpile points at the end. Just Pure Crazy Family Fun.

The object is to get your colored pawn to the lab with the cure.

Players can build up an army of cards that allow them to infect you, or sending you to the graveyard where you are forced you to escape or die.

A player may also steal your cure, even killing you and sending you back to start forcing you to begin all over again!

In this game of twist and turns, you'll need lots of skill and a little luck to maneuver your way of picking up the cure and making your way to the lab.

—description from the publisher

item.description: Trivial Pursuit: Rick and Morty allows fans of the hit television series to test their knowledge from 600 questions relating to Frienemies, Technology & Science, Locations, Rick and the Family, History & Events and a Wubalubadubdub Wild Card category.

Owning a growing restaurant is hard work. An aspiring restaurant entrepreneur must make wise decisions to manage day-to-day operations and keep loyal customers happy, while always innovating to draw new customers through the door. But beware, competition is fierce as other restaurateurs are also looking to build their own reputations and secure their own loyal customers.

In Dining Dynasties, each player must work to draw in business, find loyal customers and create exciting new dishes! Players manage all aspects of their restaurant in a fast paced competition with their rivals to offer the finest cuisine and carve out a share of the ever changing customer base. To do this, players must build and maintain a hand of cards to create a unique business plan of options. Players may focus on marketing to advertise for new customers and seek out unique sales opportunities, improve the mood of the restaurant by building a professional staff and improving restaurant décor, or a combination of all. Yet another option is to invest in the menu and seek to claim the title of finest cuisine among the competitors! A unique meta-game within each game round has players strategically playing menu cards to vie for the title of finest cuisine, which may provide an immediate valuable customer bonus.

Dining Dynasties also allows players to increase the restaurant size. Do you want a small gourmet bistro or a huge dining establishment? The options are yours to choose, with each new room tile providing new worker placement opportunities to further your restaurant goals. But be cautious, expanding at the wrong time can take a toll on your available cash.

Over the course of nine rounds, players strive to build the most valuable restaurant by earning reputation, increasing sales and building infrastructure. The player who chooses the most effective business plan, and best mitigates the ups and downs of the market, will emerge the winner.

-description from designer

IAM is an UNO-style card game with a party game overlay.

Each player starts with 4-7 cards in hand based on the player count. On a turn, play a card from your hand that matches either the number or color of the top card on the discard pile, then ask a question of a fellow player within a number of seats to you equal to the number on the card. (If you play a 2, for example, you must ask either your neighbor or the player next to them, going either clockwise or counter-clockwise depending on the direction of play.)

The topic of your question must be related to the card you just played, with blue cards relating to daily life, green society and community, red love and friendship, and yellow private matters. If the chosen player cannot answer or chooses not to, they must draw two cards, then the next player plays. If they answer the question, then they get to play a card. The game includes special cards, so the player questioned might be able to bounce the question back to the original questioner, pass it on to the next player, or require more people to answer as well.

If you have no matching cards on your turn, you draw a card and your turn ends. Alternatively, you might play a special card that reverses turn order or changes the color of cards that can be played.

Whoever plays all of their cards first wins!

GAME SYSTEM

 
 
 This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.

 



 Dice Throne is a fast-paced 2-6 player combat game, whether 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all. Select from a variety of heroes that play and feel completely distinct from one another. Attack opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly whether yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's.

Each player needs their own hero dice and cards to play Dice Throne. "Season One" of the game was released in a single box that contains components for six heroes, while "Season Two" was released in four small sets that each contain components for two heroes as well as a "Battle Chest" that has these four small sets. Heroes can be mixed-and-matched across seasons.

Linked entries in the BGG database:


 Dice Throne: Season One
 Dice Throne: Season Two â€“ Vampire Lord v. Seraph
 Dice Throne: Season Two â€“ Tactician v. Huntress
 Dice Throne: Season Two â€“ Gunslinger v. Samurai
 Dice Throne: Season Two â€“ Cursed Pirate v. Artificier
 Dice Throne: Season Two â€“ Battle Chest

Custer's Last Stand is our old school war game of two of the most famous battles of the 1876 Sioux Campaign. You get the battles of Rosebud Creek AND the Battle of Little Big Horn. The game comes with a large double sided hard mounted game board, 2 sets of rules, playbook, 2 double sided player aids, two ten-sided dice, 3 counter sheets,and a playbook.

Now be Crook at the Rosebud or Custer at the Little Big Horn OR Crazy Horse and Sitting Bull.

SEQUENCE OF PLAY SUMMARY FOR EACH TURN

Action Points (AP) Roll: Each player rolls 1 die to check for extra AP.

First Player Movement: Compare total AP. Low total moves 1st, tie go to Cavalry. Using the AP available, activates and move eligible units.

First Player Initiates Battle: Units that end the move adjacent to enemy units conduct a battle.

Second Player Movement: Using the AP available, activates and moves eligible units.

Second Player Initiates Battle: Units that end the move adjacent to enemy units occupy must conduct a battle.

End Turn: Check for victory and if so, the game is over. Otherwise, move the turn marker one ahead on the turn track and go to step 1.

Victory is determined by killing units and terrain objectives.

Playable by 1 to 2 players in under 2 hours. Low complexity.

-description from designer

link.value: Banso Inc. (株式会社バンソウ)

item.description:
This game is based in London in 1890, and the player is setting up a department store. The store consists of a number of departments, which each need to be filled with stock. Customers come to the store with a list of items that need to be bought. If all items are sold by a single player's department store, then that player wins that customer. If the customer still has items remaining to be bought, then they move onto the next player's department.

This is mainly a card-based game, where customers, items to be bought, and departments are represented by cards, and stock is represented by small wooden cubes. On a player's turn, they can choose a customer from 3 available customers, who each have a number of items that they want to buy, the number of which are decided by the roll of a dice. Only the number of items to buy is visible to the player, not the actual items themselves, so it's only when the customer is chosen that the items are revealed and the player knows what can be sold. Players receive money for items sold, which can then be used to buy new stock or new departments at the end of their turn.

The game relies on players choosing the right departments to set up, depending on what other players have already chosen, and deciding which departments should get restocked and at what time, especially when money is limited. A player wins by being the player with the highest number of customers that had all items sold during one turn. There are bonus points available for having the majority of customers in each family of customer.

Game contains 70 cards, 50 wooden cubes, 1 dice, 45 £1/£2/£5/£10 notes and a rule book.

-description from designer
Build your way through the board in QBO2 and take care to wipe your tracks. Special tiles support you to play offensively and defensively.

This is the third edition of very popular Warhammer Fantasy Battles wargame, with a complex movement system and new specialist troop types.

Warhammer Fantasy Battles is a tabletop game for two or more players where you command several armies from a huge range that goes from Humans, Dwarves, Elves, Undead, Orcs, Beastmen, Ratmen called Skaven, and other fantasy races. This starter set provides you with all the rules you need to play, a core for two armies, and guides you through collecting and painting your own army of Citadel miniatures.

The Warhammer rulebook is a 304-page hardback book. Within its covers the book is divided into seven sections: Introduction, The Basic Game, Advanced Rules, Magic, The Warhammer World, The Bestiary, and Forenrond's Last Stand.

link.value: Realm of Chaos: Slaves to Darkness
Realm of Chaos: The Lost and the Damned
Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (4th Edition)

item.description:
In TOKYO GAME SHOW you will host 5 rounds of a Japanese game show, inviting up to 5 of your friends to put on colorful wrist bands and compete in your mini games! With over 50 included games from 10 categories, plus the option to use any of the other TOKYO SERIES titles as game show games, this party hit is perfect for any player count or skill level!

—description from the publisher

Praise is a game about discovering who is giving you genuine versus fake compliments. In Japanese culture, many people praise others as a cultural norm, but your true friends have to be discovered by their honest praises!

This new version of the game has been translated and updated by Jordan Draper, with a bonus cool guy standee, giant custom die, and emotion cards that must be implemented when giving complements.

—description from the publisher

Colorful is a game about categorizing and matching colors as a group. Each round a player will come up with a specific example within a broad topic, for the group to secretly match with a color card from their hand. After 5 rounds, cards are checked to see if the group or an individual wins!

—description from the publisher

link.value: Match Me!: What color is this?

item.description:
Cactus is a dexterity game that has players competing for flowers in the desert by stacking strange colored shapes onto cactus! Cactus shares around half of the pieces with tribe (plus many new), a desert re-theme, new color scheme, around a 50% size reduction, and new die.

—description from the publisher

A game of convention goals, but mostly horseplay.

All of the fun (and sometimes frustration) of attending a convention in one convenient game!

Collect swag, signatures, art or attend panels and other events to accumulate the most "fun" or "points" and have the best convention ever!

As with most conventions, however, sometimes things don't go quite as planned as your time quickly slips away.

Play against your friends and inconvenience them from obtaining their goals while attempting to achieve your own!

—description from the publisher

In Doomsday, players take on the roles of the last inhabitants of the island kingdom of Atlantis. Earthquakes are ravaging the island and large chunks of it keep falling into the sea! You have to keep moving each round, trying to find the safest space on the island. Those who choose unwisely will fall into the sea and be lost forever!

All is not lost, however. Boreas, the wind god, has taken pity on the doomed Atlanteans and has pledged to save the most worthy of you. Whoever can survive to the end will be swept up by Boreas and carried to safety. Do you have what it takes to outsmart your opponents and live to tell the tale?

Doomsday is a card game that integrates with a mobile app to create a fun, light-hearted party game. It is a social-deduction game of bluffing, persuasion, back stabbing and reading your opponents. Each round, players simultaneously select a location card from their hand to travel to. If too many people travel to the same location, the mobile app will eliminate some of them.

Location cards have special abilities that may modify the usual flow of the game, but play will continue until there are two players left who face off in a showdown. Depending on their choices, there may be one winner, two winners, or they may both lose! Games are quick and designed to be played multiple times in succession.

—description from the publisher

Turn by turn in NU2, you choose tiles to build a path between your pawns: one path forward and one path back. Choose wisely, or you might be help another player to win the game.

—description from the publisher

Be the first to find the opposite cookie to win the round! Cinnamon or chocolate? Round or square? Solid or hollow? Plain or textured? Wavy or straight?

Who will spot the right goodie first to win Box of Cookies?

Shadows of the Academy is a cooperative card game designed for students in grades 4-7. Created as part of Alberta Health's tobacco prevention curriculum, the game has players take the roles of students in a mysterious academy, trying to defeat dastardly villains while keeping their friends safe. The students all have two unique ability cards that may be played once during the game.

Players win when they defeat 5 villains, but they lose if any player is unable to draw at the beginning of their turn, or if the deck of cards is depleted before all 5 villains are defeated.

Players may play cards from their hand to heal themselves or their peers, or to weaken villains. Harm cards lower hand size, so keeping an eye on each other is an integral part of the gameplay, as cards drawn at the end of a round could be helpful, they could be harmful, or they could be another villain to fight!

-description from designer

A version of the classic board game based on the tragically hilarious animated Netflix series. Players take on the role of talent agents pining to sign the best clients by buying, selling, and trading Production Companies and Studios in Hollywoo!

name.value: Warhammer Battle: Règles de Combat pour Armées Fantastiques

item.description:
This is the second edition of very popular Warhammer Fantasy Battles wargame, released shortly after the first edition.

Warhammer Fantasy Battles is a tabletop game for two or more players where you command several armies from a huge range that goes from Humans, Dwarves, Elves, Undead, Orcs, Lizardmen, and other fantasy races. This starter set provides you with all the rules you need to play, a core for two armies, and guides you through collecting and painting your own army of Citadel miniatures.

This edition consists of three books: Combat, Magic, and Battle Bestiary.

link.value: Ravening Hordes: The Official Warhammer Battle Army Lists
Warhammer: The Mass Combat Fantasy Roleplaying Game (1st Edition)

item.description:
Take command of your very own pirate ship, and blast off to the rings and moons of Saturn! The high seas are no match for the adventures that await you and your crew as you race against rivals, and battle for resources and treasures. You'll need split-second planning to outmaneuver and outwit the other captains if you want to claim this section of space as your own!

Folding Space is a highly approachable game for 3 to 6 players, ages 10 and up, that takes approximately 30-45 minutes to play. The game features an innovative infinity board for all players to give orders to their crew simultaneously, and those players will pillage resources, acquire treasure maps, and battle their space pirate rivals on a modular tile map.

name.value: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine Fluxx

item.description:
Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game. There are many editions, themed siblings, and promo cards available.

Explore the farthest reaches of the universe in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine Fluxx! Work alongside Benjamin Sisko, Quark, Jadzia Dax, Worf and all your other favorite space station personnel while you try to gather Gold-Pressed Latinum and study The Wormhole — but watch our for nasty Surprises and Creepers like the Founders and the Jem'Hadar.

—description from the publisher

In ChronoTrek, a time-travel game similar to Chrononauts but set in the Star Trek universe, each player becomes a Star Trek character with a unique identity and a secret mission. During the game, players travel backwards and forwards through history, doing all those things people have always dreamed of using time travel to do: Visiting the great moments of the past, peeking into the future, collecting up artifacts, coming to grips with the paradoxes of time travel, and of course, changing pivotal events and altering the course of history itself.

Explore the history (and alternate history!) of the entire Star Trek universe in this version of Chrononauts. Try to alter history to restore your specific timeline! Maybe you need to ensure that the Federation gets founded, or just retrieve the Orb of Time and some tea. Earl Grey. Hot.

—description from the publisher

The object is to not let any raptors fall down the enclosure during your turn. Create a web of colored sticks across the tree and place the raptors inside the enclosure. Then roll the die and take turns removing one stick at a time—whichever color stick the die indicates. Be careful because one false move will cause raptors to fall and then you have to add them to your pile! The player to drop the fewest raptors wins!

However, if a player causes Blue to fall, that player wins the game even if he has more raptors than other players.

Game comes with 1 bright yellow, translucent plastic palm tree so you can see the raptors wriggle as you try to catch their tails on plastic sticks. Also included are 30 raptors, 30 multiple colored sticks, and a special die.

name.value: ダイスガールズ Track２ (Dice Girls Track 2)

link.value: ダイスガールズ Track 3 (Dice Girls Track 3)
ダイスガールズ Track 4 (Dice Girls Track 4)
ダイスガールズ Track 5 (Dice Girls Track 5)

name.value: Emojinks: A Fast-Paced Emoji Card Game

item.description: This is a fast paced game in which each player has a card with a number of emoji images. Each pair of cards have exactly one matching image. The goal of the game is to find the matching image faster than your opponents. There are two sides to each card: an easy side and a more advanced side.

name.value: Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (6th Edition Boxed Set)

item.description: The boxed set for the sixth edition of Warhammer contained the rulebook and two small forces, Orcs vs. Empire.

link.value: Warhammer: Conquest of the New World
Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles (6th Edition)

item.description: Riddle Cube is a quick, family game where up to 4 players pull a malleable cube with elasticated string components to race to see who can construct the desired shape in a minute. Points are scored for the quickest player to construct the shape. Pretty simple game.

With the No Trumps card game, gameplay is simple yet interesting and always entertaining. The "reader" reads off two quotes from the selected card. The other players then have to guess which quote was actually said by Donald Trump. The player with the fewest Trump cards after ten rounds is declared the winner.
